meanings.definition: The state or quality of being perfect.
meanings.sent1: Her painting displayed a remarkable perfectness in every detail.
meanings.sent2: The perfectness of the diamond made it sparkle brilliantly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his attempt to achieve perfectness in the project fell short.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a vision of perfectness, with each flower blooming in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The perfectness of the symphony left the audience in awe of its beauty.

meanings.definition: The condition of being without fault or defect.
meanings.sent1: The perfectness of the plan ensured its success without any errors.
meanings.sent2: She aimed for perfectness in her work, striving for flawlessness in every task.
meanings.sent3: The chef's quest for perfectness in the dish led to a hilarious cooking mishap.
meanings.sent4: The perfectness of the mirror reflection made it seem like a flawless image.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to perfectness in his craftsmanship was evident in the intricate details.

meanings.definition: The highest degree of excellence or quality.
meanings.sent1: The perfectness of her performance on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The artist's pursuit of perfectness in his art resulted in breathtaking masterpieces.
meanings.sent3: The quest for perfectness in the competition pushed the athletes to their limits.
